headline: How the death of a far-right activist has shaken up the French left's mayoral campaigns
subhead: Since the tragedy in Lyon on February 14, activists from radical left La France Insoumise have faced rising hostility on the ground. Other left-wing parties are now pressed to say if they'll ally with LFI locally.

headline: Epstein case: Bill Clinton scrutinized over past relationship with sexual predator
Mediator Oman hails 'breakthrough' in US-Iran nuclear talks
Paramount acquires Warner Bros. in $110 billion deal, creating Hollywood behemoth
subhead: The final deal caps a five-month bidding battle with Netflix, and will give birth to one of the most powerful entertainment conglomerates in the world.

headline: 'He changed in a very insidious way': Parents' distress at sons embracing toxic masculinity
subhead: The rise of masculinist rhetoric among young people is creating new tensions within families. Mothers and sisters are often targeted by boys who have been radicalized online. Fathers are left feeling helpless.

headline: Bruno Mars stays as 'feel good' as ever with his new album, 'The Romantic'
subhead: The American multi-instrumentalist and singer is releasing his fourth solo album, ten years after the success of '24K Magic.'

headline: David W. Bates, cybernetics specialist: 'The brain is not a computer'
subhead: With the advent of artificial intelligence, the American academic aims to avoid the pitfalls of both technophobia and transhumanism. In his view, it is necessary to move beyond a simplistic opposition between 'human' or 'natural' intelligence and AI.

headline: Bolivian military plane carrying cash crashes near La Paz, killing at least 15
Risk of open war between Afghanistan and Pakistan appears contained for now
Trump suggests a 'friendly takeover' of Cuba
Rwanda: Claude Muhayimana sentenced on appeal to 14 years in prison for 'complicity in genocide'
EU-Mercosur trade deal set to take effect without waiting for European Parliament vote
French court upholds 'far left' label for Mélenchon's LFI
Germany orders global recall of BMW
EU-Mercosur agreement: Five key questions about where things stand
Tram crash in Milan kills two people and injures 39 others
'The Louvre director's resignation raises an old question: Why do cultural execs go mad?'
Sweden confirms that drone near French aircraft carrier was Russian
Starmer weakened as Green Party wins in Labour stronghold near Manchester
How Paris is turning into 'Frollywood,' a refuge for American actors
subhead: Whether George Clooney, Matt Dillon or Kristen Stewart, France is attracting more and more actors from across the Atlantic. This trend speaks to both the Trump-era crisis and the decline of the Hollywood model.

headline: Ukraine: 'The war could still last for years and paradoxically, time is not on the Kremlin's side'
subhead: Researcher Dimitri Minic tells Le Monde in an interview that it is 'too soon to write off Ukraine,' even though the balance of power currently favors Russia.

headline: The Langs' troubling friendship with Jeffrey Epstein
subhead: Former French culture minister Jack Lang and his daughter Caroline Lang appear thousands of times in the most recently released documents. All evidence suggests that she had a much closer relationship with the sex offender than she now admits.

headline: 'Jeffrey Epstein's trajectory shows that bluff and deceit remain commonplace'
'The Epstein scandal is astonishing by the scale of the complicity and rape culture at the top of society'
'Women are much more frequently victims of physical violence at work than men'
